name: Ben Shneiderman
existing_text: Ben Shneiderman is an active and longtime research contributor with more than 400 publications  since 1972. Shneiderman's published work includes 208 journal articles  and 197 proceedings papers
generated_text1: Ben Shneiderman is a renowned computer scientist and professor at the University of Maryland. He is best known for his work in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Information Visualization, and the development of the 'Direct Manipulation' user interface. He has published over 400 pieces of work, including 208 journal articles and 197 proceedings papers.
generated_text2: Ben Shneiderman is a computer scientist and professor at the University of Maryland. He is best known for his pioneering work in Human-Computer Interaction, particularly in the areas of information visualization, user interface design, and the development of direct manipulation techniques. He has published over 400 works, including 208 journal articles. He is the founding director of the Human-Computer Interaction Lab at the University of Maryland, and has won numerous awards for his work, including the ACM CHI Lifetime
